title: How to prove or disprove that: A - (B - C) = (A - B) - C - Quora

response.answer_text: This is an assumption that the Associative Property of Subtraction is true… it is false because there are many counterexamples. To prove it false, assume it's true and then proceed to use a counterexample… the cool thing is you only need one of them, so here's one: let A = 4, B = 5, C = 6. Assume A - (B - C) = (A - B) - C is true. So… 4 - (5 - 6) = (4 - 5) - 64 - (-1) = (-1) - 65 = -7… which we can see is false, so the original statement is false!

This is really not that easy to prove or disprove as it may indicates. First you need to define what ‘-’ and ‘()’ are, then you need to pointed out which set does this equation should be applied. Is it natural number set, integer set, real number set, or any other sets? (No, this equation is not always right or wrong under different sets. You can even carefully build a set that allows a-b-c=a+b+c, although that set could be useless) I recommend you to read Analysis I by Trence Tao. The first 4 chapters should be enough to awnser your question, or at least give some clues.

This is quite easy to disprove. Just let [math]A= 2[/math], [math]B=1[/math] and [math]C=1:[/math] [math]\displaystyle  2 - ( 1 - 1) = 2 \neq 0 = (2-1) -1. \tag*{}[/math] One can also just subtract [math](A-B) -C[/math] from both sides, and then the left-hand side would need to be equal to [math]0[/math], but it is not for [math]C \neq 0[/math] because [math]\displaystyle A - (B-C) - ((A-B)-C) = A - B + C - A + B + C = 2C. \tag*{}[/math]

Proving is a lot more difficult than disproving and that is because you make a statement that should hold for all A, B and C. Now choose A=5, B=3, C=2 and the left side equals 4 and the right side equals 0. Bingo! You disproved it. To disprove a universal statement you just have to find one counterexample.
Let A =3, B=2, C=1 A-(B-C) = 3 -(2–1) = 3 - 1 =2 (A-B)-C =(3–2) -1 = 1–1 =0 Therefore, A-(B-C) is not equal to (A-B)-C
A-(B-C)=A-B+C distributive property =(A-B)+C associative property does not equal. (A-B)-C
The statement “A - (B-C) = (A - B) - C can be proven using the associative property of subtraction.
